comment: She has been my favorite professor so far! It's a pretty easy and enjoyable class, you really just have to do the work, read and show up. She also gives plenty of extra credit opportunities which is appreciated. Only "bad" thing I can say is expect to write a few three-page papers throughout the semester.
Really nice, fave professor ever, never fails people

She is a nice lady and is easy to talk to, but she is a stickler on grading papers and discussions. The papers are 3 pages long and she makes sure you reach that page limit. The class itself is easy but long and full of reading and writing. She will sometimes do pop writing on the subject, so make sure you read the textbook before class.

I enjoyed Professor Bobos class! Clear expectations, easy A. She was personable and made the class discussions interesting and relevant todays world. We had assigned readings and discussion posts and essays. I would take it again and I've already recommended friends to.

Best professor ever! If you do the work you will pass. Lectures are very interesting and interactive, we had very respectful, educational lectures about great topics that we can relate to in our world. Attendance is a participation grade. The weekly discussions are easy , they align with the weekly readings which are easy. Very easy A with effort.

It is a very easy class with easy topics but I have never had a professor so nit-picky about the essays and discussion post. I've had easier English professors than Lavonia. Be prepared to be writing discussions post every week, and 3+ page papers. I personally would not recommend.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: She is funny and personable and encourages students to speak up about their thoughts and opinions. This is a very progressive course that touches on topics often avoided in educational environments, so I found my experience refreshing and rewarding. While there is plenty of reading, writing, and class discussion, I still enjoyed her class a lot.
